nodes.bodyText: IgniteServices has a "keep binary" flag that makes the server side NOT to deserialize parameters, thus, allowing NOT having Java classes on the server. You need to do this block only if the "keep binary" flag is not set. Otherwise it will do that Array.newInstance thing even when "keep binary = true".

Array.newInstance is called only when array type does not match. keepBinary mode requires the same treatment as normal mode - service may take BinaryObject[], so array conversion is necessary. I've added tests for both .NET->.NET and .NET->Java calls to demonstrate this.
Please do the same in "keep binary" mode.

Can we repeat these checks in "keep binary" mode as well? (with
var binPrx = Services.WithKeepBinary().GetServiceProxy(SvcName);
